pageContext.claim: “Thirty-five thousand mail-in ballots were rejected in Florida's primary, and one hundred thousand were rejected in California, and that's just the beginning.”
pageContext.analysis: These numbers may sound outrageous but they are the result of zealous actions by election officials trying to ensure election security. Moreover, these rejections are a tiny percentage of the votes cast in each state — nearly nine million people voted in Florida in the 2016 election.
